docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ACMDTNS   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The total charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for all accommodations (routine hospital room and board charges for general care, coronary care and/or intensive care units) related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is the sum of MEDPAR private room charge amounts, MEDPAR semiprivate room charge amount, MEDPAR ward charge amount, MEDPAR intensive care charge amount, and MEDPAR coronary care charge amount (i.e., the accumulation of the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 0100 - 0219 from all claim records included in the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR All Accommodations Total Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  AMBLNC   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for ambulance services related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 054x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Ambulance Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ANSTHSA   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for anesthesia services provided during the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 037X from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Anesthesia Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BASE_OPRTG_DRG_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The sum of the claim base operating DRG amounts reported on the claims that comprise the stay. The base operating DRG amount used to identify the wage-adjusted DRG operating payment plus the new technology add-on payment.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the Claim Base Operating DRG amount (CLM-BASE-OPRTG-DRG-AMT) that is present on any of the claim records included in the stay (i.e. the sum of the claim base operating DRG amounts reported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Base Operating DRG Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  AGE_CNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The beneficiary’s age as of date of admission.  NOTE: This field is derived by subtracting the bene date of birth from the admission date, present on the first claim record included in the stay. Exception: If the resulting age is 64, and the MSC = 10 or 11, the age is changed to 65.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Age Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BLDDEDAM
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Blood Deductible Liability Amount

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  DEATHDT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The date the beneficiary died.  Derivation This field comes from the beneficiary death date, if present on the enrollment database, which is accessed prior to creation of the quarterly MEDPAR file. Limitation DESCRIPTION :
The Date of Death on the MEDPAR files were not up-to-date for four cycles.
BACKGROUND  :
 The MEDPAR process pulls in 10 segments of the HISKEW file, to get the date of death.  The HISKEW file names were changed with no notification the change was being made.  Because of this, MEDPAR kept using the HISKEW that was created in June 2000.
The incomplete MEDPAR cycles are: 12/2000, 3/2001,  6/2001 and 9/2001 (9/2000 MEDPAR was not run).
CORRECTIVE ACTION :
Since this anamoly causes no major problem to the prime user of this data, a rerun will not take place.
NOTE:  The 12/01 quarterly update will access up-to-date information.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Death Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DEATHCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating whether the beneficiary's date of death has been verified or originated from a claim record.  Derivation This field is derived from the enrollment database's beneficiary source death date code, or from the presence of a claim status code = '20' (expired) on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Death Date Verified Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DSCHRGCD
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Discharge Status Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BIC   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The BIC reported on the first claim record included in the stay, representing the values existing on the CWF beneficiary master record on the date the CWF host site processed the claim.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Identification Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DED_AMT
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Inpatient Deductible Liability Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  LRD_USE   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of lifetime reserve days (LRD) used by the beneficiary for this stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the lifetime reserve days used count that is present on any of the claim records included in the stay (i.e., the sum of LRD reported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary LRD Used Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BENE_ZIP
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Mailing Contact Zip Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  EXHST_DT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The last date for which the beneficiary had Medicare coverage. This field is completed only where benefits were exhausted before the discharge date and during the period covered by stay.  Derivation This field comes from the highest benefits exhausted date that is present on the claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Medicare Benefit Exhausted Date

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  MS_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The CWF-derived reason for a beneficiary’s entitlement to Medicare benefits, as of the reference date.  Derivation CWF derives MSC from the following:
1. Date of birth
2. Claim through date
3. Original/Current reasons for entitlement
4. ESRD indicator
5. Beneficiary claim number
Items 1,3,4,5 come from the CWF beneficiary
master record; Item 2 comes from the FI/Carrier
claim record. MSC is assigned as follows:
MSC OASI DIB ESRD AGE BIC
10 YES N/A NO 65 AND OVER N/A
11 YES N/A YES 65 AND OVER N/A
20 NO YES NO UNDER 65 N/A
21 NO YES YES UNDER 65 N/A
31 NO NO YES ANY AGE T.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Medicare Status Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  COIN_AMT
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Part A Coinsurance Liability Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRPAYAMT
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Primary Payer Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRPAY_CD
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Primary Payer Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  RACE   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The race of the beneficiary.  NOTE: This field comes from the race code that is present on the first claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Race Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CNTY_CD
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Residence SSA Standard County Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  STATE_CD
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Residence SSA Standard State Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SEX   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The sex of a beneficiary.  NOTE: This field comes from the sex code that is present on the first claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Sex Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  COIN_DAY   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the total number of coinsurance days involved with the beneficiary's stay in a facility. For Inpatient services, the beneficiary is liable for a daily coinsurance amount after the 60 th  day and before the 91 st  day in a single spell of illness; for SNF services, the beneficiary is liable for a daily coinsurance amount after the 20 th  day and before the 101 st  day in a single spell of illness.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the coinsurance day count that is present on any of the claim records included in the stay (i.e., the sum of coinsurance days reported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Beneficiary Total Coinsurance Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BLDADMIN   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for blood storage and processing related to the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 039x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Blood Administration Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BLOODAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for blood provided during the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 038x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Blood Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BLDFRNSH   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The quantity of blood (number of whole pints) furnished to the beneficiary during the stay.  Note: this includes blood pints replaced as well as not replaced.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the blood pints furnished quantity from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Blood Pints Furnished Quantity

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BNDLD_MODEL_DSCNT_PCT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The field used to identify the discount percentage that will be applied to the payment for all the hospitals' DRG over the lifetime of the initiative. The hospital must be participating in the Model 1 Bundled Payments for Care Improvement initiative.  Derivation This field comes from the Claim Bundled Model Discount (CLM-BNDLD-MODEL-1-DSCNT-PCT) that is present on the last record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Bundled Model Discount Percent

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CRDC_CATHRZTN_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the cardiac catheterization services/supplies related to the beneficiary's stay.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRG-AMT) associated with revenue center codes (REV-CNTR-CD) '0481' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Cardiac Catheterization Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CRDLGY   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for cardiology services and electrocardiogram(s) provided during the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 048X and 073X from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Cardiology Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CARE_IMPRVMT_MODEL_{x}_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code used to identify that the care improvement model is being used for bundling payments. The valid value for care improvement model 1 is  61 . The valid value for care improvement model 2 is  62 . The valid value for care improvement model 3 is  63 . The valid value for care improvement model 4 is  64 . The value is also reflected in the demonstration trailer.  Derivation This field comes from the Claim Care Improvement Model (CLM-CARE-IMPRVMT-MODEL-{x}-CD) code that is present on the first claim record included in the stay. If there is no Claim Care Improve Model code on the 1 st  claim then take the first found code on a the other claims that make up the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Care Improvement Model Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SLCT_RSN_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Specifies whether this record is a case or control record.
docs.title: MEDPAR Case or Control Record

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CLM_PTNT_RLTNSHP_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code used to identify the patient relationship to the beneficiary.  Derivation This field comes from the patient relationship code (CLM-PTNT-RLTNSHP-CD) that is present on the first claim record included in the stay. If there is no patient relationship code on the 1 st  claim then take the first found code on any of the other claims that make up the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Claim Patient Relationship Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  POA_DGNS_CD_CNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the count of the number of Present on Admission (POA) codes reported on the Inpatient/SNF claim. The purpose of this count is to indicate how many claim POA diagnosis trailers are present.
docs.title: MEDPAR Claim Present on Admission Diagnosis Code Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  POA_DGNS_E_CD_CNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the count of the number of Present on Admission (POA) codes associated with the diagnosis E codes reported on the Inpatient/SNF claim. The purpose of this count is to indicate how many claim POA diagnosis E trailers are present.
docs.title: MEDPAR Claim Present on Admission Diagnosis E Code Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CLNC_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for clinic visits (e.g., visits to chronic pain or dental centers or to clinics providing psychiatric, ob-gyn, pediatric services) related to the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 051x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Clinic Visit Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CRNRYAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for coronary care accommodations related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with accommodation revenue center code 021X from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Coronary Care Charge Amount

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  MCCCNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of coronary care days used by the beneficiary for the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center unit count associated with accommodation revenue center code 021x (all six subcategories) from all claim records included in the stay. Limitation There is approximately a 20% error rate in the revenue center code category 0214 due to coders misunderstanding the term 'post ccu' as including any day after a ccustay rather than just days in a step-down/lower case version of a ccu. 'Post' was removed from the
revenue center code 0214 description, effective 10/1/96 (12/96 MEDPAR update). 0214 Is now defined as 'intermediate ccu'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Coronary Care Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CRNRY_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating that the beneficiary has spent time under coronary care during the stay. It also specifies the type of coronary care unit.  Derivation This field is derived by checking for the presence of coronary care revenue center codes (listed below) on any of the claim records included in the stay. If more than one of the revenue center codes listed below are included on these claims, the code with the highest revenue center total charge amount is used. Limitation There is approximately a 20% error rate in the revenue center code category 0214 due to coders misunderstanding the term 'post CCU' as including any day after a CCU stay rather than just days in a step-down/lower case version of a CCU. 'Post' was removed from the revenue center code 0214 description, effective 10/1/96 (12/96 MEDPAR update). 0214 Is now defined as 'intermediate CCU'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Coronary Care Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CVRLVLDT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The date on which a covered level of care ended in a SNF.  Derivation This field comes from the date associated with occurrence code = 22 if present on any of the claims included in the stay. If multiple dates, the highest date is used. This field is only applicable to SNF claims.
docs.title: MEDPAR Covered Level Care Thru Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CRED_RCVD_RPLCD_DVC_SW   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The switch used to identify whether the provider received a credit from the Manufacturer for a replaced medical device.  Derivation If any claim that comprises the Stay has a value code (CLM-VAL-CD) equal to 'FD' populate the MEDPAR Credit Received from Manufacturer for Replaced Medical Device Switch with a 'Y'. If no 'FD' value code, populate field with an 'N'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Credit Received Replaced Device Switch

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DME_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for DME (purchase of new DME and rentals) related to the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 0290, 0291, 0292, and 0294 - 0299 from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR DME Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DRG_CD
docs.title: MEDPAR DRG Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OUTLRAMT
docs.title: MEDPAR DRG Outlier Approved Payment Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DRGPRICE
docs.title: MEDPAR DRG Price Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OUTLR_CD
docs.title: MEDPAR DRG/Outlier Stay Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DPRTMNTL   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The total charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for all ancillary departments (other than routine room and board, CCU, and ICU) related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 0220 - 0999 from all claim records included in the stay (i.e., the sum of charges for all revenue centers other than accommodations 0100 - 0219).
docs.title: MEDPAR Departmental Total Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DGNSCD{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The diagnosis code identifying the beneficiary's principal or other diagnosis (including E code).  NOTE: Prior to Version H, the principal diagnosis code was not stored with the 'OTHER' diagnosis codes. During the Version H conversion the CLM_PRNCPAL_DGNS_CD was added as the first occurrence.NOTE1: Effective with Version 'J', this field has been expanded from 5 bytes to 7 bytes to accommodate the future implementation of ICD-10.NOTE2: Effective with Version 'J', the diagnosis E codes are stored in a separate trailer (CLM_DGNS_E_GRP).  Derivation This field is the actual principal diagnosis code (1 st  occurrence) or one of up to 9 other diagnosis codes that are present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DGNSCNT
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis Code Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DGNS_POA   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Diagnosis code POA array.  Derivation This field is the actual principal diagnosis code (1 st  occurrence) or one of up to 9 other diagnosis codes that are present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis Code POA Array

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  DGNS_E_CD_CNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the count of the number of diagnosis E codes
 reported on the Inpatient/SNF claim. The purpose of this count is to 
indicate how many diagnosis E trailers are present.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis E Code Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  POA_DGNS_E_{x}_IND_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the code used to identify the Present on Admission (POA) indicator code associated with the diagnosis E codes.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis E Code Present on Admission Indicator

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DGNS_E_VRSN_CD_{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the code used to indicate if the diagnosis code is ICD-9 or ICD-10.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis E Version Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  POA_DGNS_{x}_IND_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the code used to identify the Present on Admission (POA) indicator code associated with the diagnosis codes (principal and secondary). The present on admission indicators for the diagnosis E codes are stored in the present on admission diagnosis E trailer.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis Present on Admission Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DGNS_VRSN_CD_{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the code used to indicate if the diagnosis code is ICD-9 or ICD-10.
docs.title: MEDPAR Diagnosis Version Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DSCHRGDT
docs.title: MEDPAR Discharge Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DSTNTNCD
docs.title: MEDPAR Discharge Destination Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ESRD_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating if the beneficiary had an ESRD condition reported during the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by checking for condition codes 70 - 76 on any of the claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR ESRD Condition Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ESRDSETG   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating the type of dialysis received by the beneficiary during the stay. Up to 5 2-position codes may be present.  Derivation This field is derived from the presence of the dialysis revenue center codes listed below on any of the claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR ESRD Revenue Setting Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ESRDSTG{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating the type of dialysis received by the beneficiary during the stay. Up to 5 2-position codes may be present.  Derivation This field is derived from the presence of the dialysis revenue center codes listed below on any of the claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR ESRD Setting Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ER_AMT
docs.title: MEDPAR Emergency Room Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  FICARR   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The identification of the intermediary processing the beneficiary's claims related to the stay.  NOTE: This field comes from the intermediary number that is present on the first claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Fiscal Intermediary/Carrier Identification Number

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  GHOPDCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating whether or not a GHO has paid the provider for the claim(s).  NOTE: This field comes from the GHO-paid indicator that is present on the first claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR GHO Paid Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  HRR_ADJSTMT_PCT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Under the Hospital Readmission Reduction (HRR) Program, the percent used to identify the readmission adjustment factor that will be applied in determining a subsection (d) hospital's operating IPPS payment amount in accordance with Section 3025 of the Affordable Care Act (ACA).  Derivation This field comes from the Claim HRR Adjustment Percent (CLM-HRR-ADJSTMT-PCT) that is present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR HRR Adjustment Percent

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  HRR_PRTCPNT_IND_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code used to identify whether the facility is participating in the Hospital Readmission Reduction Program.  Derivation This field comes from the Claim HRR Participant Indicator code (CLM-HRR-PRTCPNT-IND-CD) that is present on the first claim record included in the stay. If there is no Claim HRR Participant Indicator code on the first claim then take the first found code on any of the other claims that make up the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR HRR Participant Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INCDNT_DGNSTC_SRVCS_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the medical/surgical supplies incident to other diagnostic services related to the beneficiary's stay.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRG-AMT) associated with revenue center code (REV-CNTR-CD) '0622' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Incident to Other Diagnostic Services Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INCDNT_RDLGY_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the medical/surgical supplies incident to radiology related to the beneficiary's stay.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRG-AMT) associated with revenue center code (REV-CNTR-CD) '0621' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Incident to Radiology Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  IME_AMT
docs.title: MEDPAR Indirect Medical Education (IME) Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INFRMTL_ENCTR_IND_SW   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The switch used to identify if a beneficiary is enrolled in a Managed Care Organization.  Derivation If any claim that comprises the Stay has a condition code (CLM RLT COND CD) equal to '04' populate the MEDPAR Informational Encounter Switch with a 'Y'. If no '04' condition code, populate field with an 'N'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Informational Encounter Indicator Switch

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INHLTAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for inhalation therapy services (respiratory and pulmonary function) provided during the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 041x and 046x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Inhalation Therapy Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  TYPE_ADM
docs.title: MEDPAR Inpatient Admission Type Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DISP_SHR
docs.title: MEDPAR Inpatient Disproportionate Share Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  IP_LOW_VOL_PYMT_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The amount field used to identify a payment adjustment given to hospitals to account for the higher costs per discharge for low income hospitals under the Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS).  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the IP Low Volume Amount that is present on any of the claim records included in the stay (i.e. the sum of the low volume amounts re-ported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Inpatient Low Volume Payment Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ICAREAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for intensive care accommodations related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with accommodation revenue center code 020x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Intensive Care Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ICARECNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of intensive care days used by the beneficiary for the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center unit count associated with accommodation revenue center codes 020X (all 9 subcategories) from all claims included in the stay. Limitation There is approximately a 20% error rate in the revenue center code category 0206 due to coders misunderstanding the term 'post ICU' as including any day after an ICU stay rather than just days in a step-down/lower case version of an ICU. 'Post' was removed from the revenue center code 0206 description, effective 10/1/96 (12/96 MEDPAR update). 0206 Is now defined as 'intermediate ICU'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Intensive Care Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ICUINDCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating that the beneficiary has spent time under intensive care during the stay. It also specifies the type of ICU.  Derivation This field is derived by checking for the presence of icu revenue center codes (listed below) on any of the claim records included in the stay. If more than one of the revenue center codes listed below are included on these claims, the code with the highest revenue center total charge amount is used. Limitation There is approximately a 20% error rate in the revenue center code category 0206 due to coders misunderstanding the term 'post ICU' as including any day after an ICU stay rather than just days in a step-down/lower case version of an ICU. 'Post' was removed from the revenue center code 0206 description, effective 10/1/96 (12/96 MEDPAR update). 0206 Is now defined as 'intermediate ICU'.
docs.title: MEDPAR Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  IPSBCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Limited availability; for internal use only. Where not available, this field will contain zeroes.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use (By IPSB) Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  FILDTCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Limited availability; for internal use only to to identify fiscal year/calendar year segments. Where not available, this field will contain a zero.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use File Date Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INTRNL_USE_SSI_DATA   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Internal use SSI data.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use SSI Data

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SSIDAY   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Internal use SSI Day count.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use SSI Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SSICD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Internal use SSI Indicator code.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use SSI Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SMPLSIZE   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Limited availability; for internal use only to identify the MEDPAR sample size: 20% (HIC 9 th  digit = 0, 5); 20% (HIC 9 th  digit = 4, 8; 60% (remainder). Where not available, this field will contain a zero.
docs.title: MEDPAR Internal Use Sample Size Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INTRAOCULAR_LENS_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the medical/surgical intraocular lens supplies related to the beneficiary's stay.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRG-AMT) associated with revenue center code (REV-CNTR-CD) '0276' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Intraocular Lens Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  INVSTGTNL_DVC_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the medical/surgical investigational devices supplies related to the beneficiary's stay.  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9)  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRG-AMT) associated with revenue center code (REV-CNTR-CD) '0624' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Investigational Device Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  LAB_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for laboratory costs related to the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 030x, 031x, 074x, and 075x from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Laboratory Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ACRTNDT
docs.title: MEDPAR Latest Claim Accretion Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  NEW_TCHNLGY_ADD_ON_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The amount of payments made for discharges involving approved new technologies. If the total covered costs of the discharge exceeds the DRG payment for the case (including adjustments for IME and disproportionate share hospitals (DSH) but excluding outlier payments) an add-on amount is made indicating a new technology was used in the treatment of the beneficiary.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the amount field (CLM-VAL-AMT) found in the value code trailer for value code (CLM-VAL-CD) equal to '77' for any claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR New Technology Add On Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OBSRVTN_SW   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The switch used to identify whether the claim involves treatment or observation in an observation room.  Derivation If any claim that comprises the Stay has a revenue center code (REV-CNTR-CD) equal to '0762' populate the MEDPAR Observation Switch with a 'Y'. If no '0762' revenue center code populate field with an 'N'.

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OPRTG_HSP_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The sum of the claim operating HSP amounts reported on the claims that comprise the stay. The operating HSP amount is used to identify the difference between the HSP rate payment (updated HSP x DRG weight) and the federal rate payment (includes DSH, IME, outliers, etc. as applicable) when HSP rate payment exceeds Federal rate payment (otherwise $0).  NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9).  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the Claim Operating HSP Amount (CLM_OPRTG_HSP_AMT) that is present on any of the claim records included in the stay (i.e. the sum of the claim operating HSP amounts reported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Operating Hospital Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  QLFYFROM   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The beginning date of the beneficiary's qualifying stay. For Inpatient claims, the date relates to the PPS portion of the inlier for which there is no utilization to benefits. For SNF claims, the date relates to the qualifying stay from a hospital that is at least two days in a row if the source of admission is an 'a', or at least three days in a row if the source of admission is other than an 'a'.  Derivation This field comes from occurrence span code = 70 and related occurrence span from date, if present on any of the claim records included in the stay. If more than one record has an occurrence span code = 70, with different span dates, the date from the last claim record included in the stay is used.
docs.title: MEDPAR SNF Qualification From Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  QLFYTHRU   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The ending date of the beneficiary's qualifying stay. For Inpatient claims, the date relates to the PPS portion of the inlier for which there is no utilization to benefits. For SNF claims, the date relates to the qualifying stay from a hospital that is at least two days in a row if the source of admission is an 'A', or at least three days in a row if the source of admission is other than an 'A'.  Derivation This field comes from the occurrence span code = 70 and related occurrence span thru date, if present on any of the claims included in the stay. If more than one record has an occurrence span code = 70, with different span dates, the date from the last claim record included in the stay is used.
docs.title: MEDPAR SNF Qualification Through Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SPRVTAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for semi-private room accommodations related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center codes 010x, 012x, 013x, and 016x - 019x from all claim records included in the stay. Exception for SNF rugs demo effective 03/96 SNF update: field is derived from revenue center codes in the 9019-9032 series.

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SPRVTDAY   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of semi-private room days used by the beneficiary for the stay. docs.text: Short SAS Name:  FACLMCNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of claim records (final action) included in the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by counting the number of final action claims used to create the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Stay Final Action Claims Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRCDRCD{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The ICD-9-CM code identifying the principal or other surgical procedure performed during the beneficiary's stay. This element is part of the MEDPAR surgical procedure group. It may occur up to 25 times.  NOTE1: Effective with Version 'J', this field has been expanded from 5 bytes to 7 bytes to accommodate the future implementation of ICD-10.  Derivation This field is the actual principal surgical procedure code (1 st  occurrence) or one of up to 24 other surgical procedure codes that may be present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Surgical Procedure Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRCDRCNT
docs.title: MEDPAR Surgical Procedure Code Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRCDRSW   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The switch indicating whether or not there were any surgical procedures performed during the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by checking for the presence of procedure codes on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Surgical Procedure Indicator Switch

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRCDRDT{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The date on which the icd-9-cm surgical procedure was performed during the beneficiary's stay. This element is part of the MEDPAR surgical procedure group. It can occur up to 25 times.  Derivation This field is the actual date associated with the principal or one of up to 24 other surgical procedure codes that is present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Surgical Procedure Performed Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRCDTCNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of dates associated with the surgical procedures included in the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by counting the surgical procedures dates that are reported on the last claim record included in the stay.

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SRGCL_PRCDR_VRSN_CD_{x}   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Effective with Version 'J', the code used to indicate if the surgical procedure code is ICD-9 or ICD-10.

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  TAKE_HOME_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for the medical/surgical take home supplies related to the beneficiary's stay.   NOTE: Effective with MEDPAR2000 expansion, all amount fields were expanded from S9(7) to S9(9).  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount (REV-CNTR-TOT-CHRGAMT) associated with revenue center code (REV-CNTRCD) '0273' from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Take Home Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  TOTCHRG   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The total amount (rounded to whole dollars) of all charges (covered and non-covered) for all services provided to the beneficiary for the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the total charge amount from all claim records included in the stay (i.e., the sum of total charges reported on the claims that comprise the stay).
docs.title: MEDPAR Total Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  CVRCHRG   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The portion of the total charges amount (rounded to wholedollars) that is covered by Medicare for the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by calculating the covered charges from all claim records included in the stay (i.e.,subtract the revenue center non-covered charge amount from the revenue center total charge amount for revenue center code = 0001 that is reported on the claims that comprise the stay; sum the results). Exception: if there exists an erroneous condition relative to revenue center code 0001, the calculation will be made for each revenue center code included on the claims that comprise the stay with the results summed to create the total.
docs.title: MEDPAR Total Covered Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PPS_CPTL
docs.title: MEDPAR Total PPS Capital Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PASSTHRU
docs.title: MEDPAR Total Pass Through Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  TRNSPLNT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code indicating whether or not the beneficiary received a organ transplant during the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by checking for the presence of the transplant revenue center code (listed below) on any of the claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Transplant Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  UDME_AMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for used DME (purchase of used DME) related to the beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 0293 from all claim records included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR Used DME Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  UTIL_DAY
docs.title: MEDPAR Utilization Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  VBP_ADJSTMT_PCT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Under the Hospital Value Based Purchasing (HVBP) program, the percent used to identify an adjustment made to certain subsection (d) IPPS hospital's base operating DRG amount, in accordance with their Total Performance Score (TPS) as required by the Affordable Care Act (ACA). This is the Value Based Purchasing Score.  Derivation This field comes from the Claim VBP Adjustment Percent (CLM-VBP-CLM-ADJSTMT-PCT) that is present on the last claim record included in the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR VBP Adjustment Percent

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  VBP_PRTCPNT_IND_CD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The code used to identify a reason a hospital is excluded from the Hospital Value Based Purchasing (HVBP) program. The ACA (Section 3001) excludes from HVBP program hospitals that meet certain conditions.  Derivation This field comes from the Claim VBP Participant Indicator code (CLM-VBP-PRTCPNT-IND-CD) that is present on the first claim record included in the stay. If there is no Claim VBP Participant Indicator code on the first claim then take the first found code on any of the other claims that make up the stay.
docs.title: MEDPAR VBP Participant Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  WARDAMT   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The charge amount (rounded to whole dollars) for ward accommodations related to a beneficiary's stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center total charge amount associated with revenue center code 015x from all claim records included in the stay. Exception for SNF rugs demo effective 03/96 SNF update: this field is derived from revenue center codes in the 9000-9018 series.
docs.title: MEDPAR Ward Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  WARDDAY   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The count of the number of ward days used by the beneficiary for the stay.  Derivation This field is derived by accumulating the revenue center unit count associated with accommodation revenue center code 015x from all claim records included in the stay. Exception for SNF rugs demo eff 3/96 SNF update: field is derived from revenue center codes in the 9000-9018 series.
docs.title: MEDPAR Ward Day Count

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  WRNGCD   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   The codes (commonly called warning indicators) specifying detailed billing information obtained from the claims analyzed for the stay process. The purpose of these codes is to provide additional information for the MEDPAR user; i.e., let the user know whether or not the stay included adjustments, a single claim or multiple claims, any error conditions, etc.  Derivation This field is packed. Each of the digits identify a specific item of interest to users of the MEDPAR file. Warning indicators 1 and 6, and the first two values of indicator 8, are set early in the process – while processing all claims through the final action algorithm, prior to the creation of the stay record. The other indicators are derived from the claims remaining after the final action processing, which are used to created the stay record.
docs.title: MEDPAR Warning Indicators Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  MEDPAR_YR_NUM   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Year of the MedPAR Record.
docs.title: MEDPAR Year of Record

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DEPSN_MEDICARE   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates whether a beneficiary met the condition criteria for major depressive affective disorder as of the end of the calendar year.  NOTE: The condition variable requires beneficiaries to satisfy both claims criteria (a minimum number/type of Medicare claims that have the proper diagnosis codes and occurred within a specified time period) and coverage criteria (Medicare FFS Part A and Part B coverage during the entire specified time period).  NOTE1: For major depressive affective disorder, beneficiaries must have at least one Medicare inpatient claim or two other non-drug claims of any service type with a related code in any position during the 2-year reference period. You can find more detailed information on the criteria on the CCW website: https://www.ccwdata.org/web/guest/condition-categories
docs.title: Major Depressive Affective Disorder End-of-Year Indicator - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DEPSN_MEDICARE_EVER   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable shows the date when the beneficiary first met the criteria for the major depressive affective disorder indicator. The variable will be blank for beneficiaries that have never had the condition.  NOTE: The earliest possible date for anyone in the CCW is January 1, 1999. If the beneficiary became eligible for Medicare after that, the earliest possible date will be some time after his/her coverage start date (i.e., the COVSTART variable in the Beneficiary File).
docs.title: Major Depressive Affective Disorder First Ever Occurrence Date - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  MEDPARID   Contained in   MedPAR RIF   Unique key for MEDPAR claim.
docs.title: MedPAR ID Number

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  COVSTART  Long SAS Name:  COVSTART   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable is the date when the beneficiary first became eligible for Medicare coverage (Part A or Part B).  Historic date of 1 st  Medicare coverage (may be prior to 1999, which is the earliest claim files available through CCW)
docs.title: Medicare Coverage Start Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BUYIN04  Long SAS Name:  MDCR_ENTLMT_BUYIN_IND_04   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates whether the beneficiary was entitled to Part A, Part B, or both for a given month. There are 12 monthly variables - where the 01 through 12 at the end of the variable name correspond with the month (e.g., 01 is January and 12 is December). The variable also indicates whether the beneficiary’s state of residence paid his/her monthly premium for Part B coverage (and Part A if necessary). State Medicaid programs can pay those premiums for certain dual eligibles; this action is called “buying in” and so this variable is the “buy-in code.”
docs.title: Medicare Entitlement/Buy-In Indicator - April

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  SAMPLE_GROUP  Long SAS Name:  SAMPLE_GROUP   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   Medicare 1, 5, or 20% strict sample group indicator.  CCW creates the sample values using standard CMS processes to identify the random 1, 5, 15, and 20 percent samples of Medicare beneficiaries.
The sample groups are based on a random 20 percent sample that is split into three mutually exclusive groups of 1 percent, 4 percent, and 15 percent.
To use the 1 percent sample, specify that SAMPLE_GRP equals “01”.
To use the 5 percent sample, specify that SAMPLE_GRP equals “01” or “04”.
To use the 15 percent sample, specify that SAMPLE_GRP equals “15”.
To use the 20 percent sample, specify that SAMPLE_GRP equals “01”, “04”, or “15”.
Beneficiaries are assigned to sample groups each year based on the last two digits of their Medicare Claim Account Numbers (CANs). Since CANs can change over time (e.g., in the case of remarriage), new beneficiaries are becoming eligible for Medicare, and existing beneficiaries are dying, the sample is cross-sectional. There is no guarantee that the exact same beneficiaries are represented in the same sample group from one year to the next (i.e., this is the strict sampling).
docs.title: Medicare Sample Group Indicator

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  MDCR_STUS_CD_04  Long SAS Name:  MDCR_STATUS_CODE_04   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates how a beneficiary currently qualifies for Medicare - in April.  Analysts can use this variable to quickly distinguish between the aged, disabled, and ESRD populations.
This field is coded from age, original reason for entitlement, current reason for entitlement and ESRD indicator contained in the enrollment data base at CMS.
There are 12 monthly variables - where the 01 through 12 at the end of the variable name correspond with the month (e.g., 01 is January and 12 is December).
docs.title: Medicare Status Code - April

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  DUAL_04  Long SAS Name:  DUAL_STUS_CD_04   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates whether the beneficiary was eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid in a given month (April).  The original source for this variable is the State Medicare Modernization Act (MMA) files that states submit to CMS. Those files are considered the “gold standard” for identifying dual eligibles because the information in them is used to determine the level of Medicare Part D low-income subsidies. Dual eligibles are often divided into “full duals” and “partial duals” based on the level of Medicaid benefits they receive. CMS generally considers beneficiaries to be full duals if they have values of 02, 04, or 08, and to be partial duals if they have values of 01, 03, 05, or 06. Partial duals sometimes divided into the QMB-only population (01) and all other partial duals (03, 05, or 06). There are
CMS Chronic Conditions Data Warehouse (CCW) – Codebook
Master Beneficiary Summary File (MBSF) with Medicare Part A, B, C & D
May 2017 – Version 1.0 Page 56 of 225
different ways to classify dually eligible beneficiaries. Additional information regarding various ways to identify dually enrolled populations, refer to a CCW Technical Guidance document entitled: "Options in Determining Dual Eligibles". There are 12 monthly variables - where the 01 through 12 at the end of the variable name correspond with the month (e.g., 01 is January and 12 is December).
docs.title: Medicare-Medicaid dual eligibility code - April

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  DUAL_01  Long SAS Name:  DUAL_STUS_CD_01   Contained in  This variable indicates whether the beneficiary was eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid in a given month (January).  The original source for this variable is the State Medicare Modernization Act (MMA) files that states submit to CMS. Those files are considered the “gold standard” for identifying dual eligibles because the information in them is used to determine the level of Medicare Part D low-income subsidies. Dual eligibles are often divided into “full duals” and “partial duals” based on the level of Medicaid benefits they receive. CMS generally considers beneficiaries to be full duals if they have values of 02, 04, or 08, and to be partial duals if they have values of 01, 03, 05, or 06. Partial duals sometimes divided into the QMB-only population (01) and all other partial duals (03, 05, or 06). There are
CMS Chronic Conditions Data Warehouse (CCW) – Codebook
Master Beneficiary Summary File (MBSF) with Medicare Part A, B, C & D
May 2017 – Version 1.0 Page 56 of 225
different ways to classify dually eligible beneficiaries. Additional information regarding various ways to identify dually enrolled populations, refer to a CCW Technical Guidance document entitled: "Options in Determining Dual Eligibles". There are 12 monthly variables - where the 01 through 12 at the end of the variable name correspond with the month (e.g., 01 is January and 12 is December).
docs.title: Medicare-Medicaid dual eligibility code - January

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  MIGRAINE_MEDICARE   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates whether a beneficiary met the condition criteria for migraine and other chronic headache as of the end of the calendar year.  NOTE: The condition variable requires beneficiaries to satisfy both claims criteria (a minimum number/type of Medicare claims that have the proper diagnosis codes and occurred within a specified time period) and coverage criteria (Medicare FFS Part A and Part B coverage during the entire specified time period).  NOTE1: For migraine and other chronic headache, beneficiaries must have at least one Medicare inpatient claim or two other non-drug claims of any service type with a related code in any position during the 2-year reference period. You can find more detailed information on the criteria on the CCW website: https://www.ccwdata.org/web/guest/condition-categories
docs.title: Migraine and other Chronic Headache End-of-Year Indicator - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  MIGRAINE_MEDICARE_EVER   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable shows the date when the beneficiary first met the criteria for the migraine and other chronic headache indicator. The variable will be blank for beneficiaries that have never had the condition.  NOTE: The earliest possible date for anyone in the CCW is January 1, 1999. If the beneficiary became eligible for Medicare after that, the earliest possible date will be some time after his/her coverage start date (i.e., the COVSTART variable in the Beneficiary File).
docs.title: Migraine and other Chronic Headache First Ever Occurrence Date - Medicare Only Claims

NOTE1: For mobility impairments, beneficiaries must have at least one Medicare inpatient claim or two other non-drug claims of any service type with a related code in any position during the 2-year reference period. You can find more detailed information on the criteria on the CCW website: https://www.ccwdata.org/web/guest/condition-categories
docs.title: Mobility Impairments End-of-Year Indicator - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  DUAL_MO  Long SAS Name:  DUAL_ELGBL_MONS   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable is the number of months during the year that the beneficiary was dually eligible (i.e., he/she was also eligible for Medicaid benefits).  CCW derived this variable by counting the number of months where the beneficiary had dual eligibility (DUAL_STUS_CD_XX not equal to  00  or '**').
There are different ways to classify dually eligible beneficiaries - in terms of whether he/she is enrolled in full or partial benefits. Additional information regarding various ways to identify dually enrolled populations, refer to a CCW Technical Guidance document entitled: "Options in Determining Dual Eligibles"
docs.title: Months of Dual Eligibility

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PTD_MO  Long SAS Name:  PTD_PLAN_CVRG_MONS   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable is the number of months during the year that the beneficiary had Medicare Part D coverage. CCW derives this variable by counting the number of months where the beneficiary had Part D coverage.  A Part D covered month is one where the first value of the monthly PTD_CNTRCT_ID_XX variable equaled H, R, S, or E or the value was X followed by 4 alphanumeric characters.
docs.title: Months of Part D Coverage

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  RDS_MO  Long SAS Name:  RDS_CVRG_MONS   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable is the number of months during the year that the beneficiary was enrolled in an employer-sponsored prescription drug plan that qualified for Part D’s retiree drug subsidy (RDS). CCW derives this variable by counting the number of months where the beneficiary had retiree drug subsidy.  A month of RDS is when the RDS_IND_XX for the month = Y.
Some employers offer prescription drug plans to their retirees, and Part D pays a subsidy to plans that offer coverage that is equivalent to (or better than) conventional Part D benefits.
CMS does not collect PDEs for beneficiaries that are enrolled in RDS-eligible plans.
docs.title: Months of Retiree Drug Subsidy Coverage

Short SAS Name:  CARETHRU  Long SAS Name:  NCH_ACTV_OR_CVRD_LVL_CARE_THRU   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   The date on a claim for which the covered level of care ended in a general hospital or the active care ended in a psychiatric/TB hospital.  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_RLT_OCRNC_CD
CLM_RLT_OCRNC_DT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of occurrence code 22 move the related occurrence date to NCH_ACTV_CVR_LVL_CARE_THRU_DT.
docs.title: NCH Active or Covered Level Care Thru Date

Short SAS Name:  EXHST_DT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_BENE_MDCR_BNFTS_EXHTD_DT_I   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   The last date for which the beneficiary has Medicare coverage. This is completed only where where benefits were exhausted before the date of discharge and during the billing period covered by this institutional claim.  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_RLT_OCRNC_CD
CLM_RLT_OCRNC_DT DERIVATION RULES (Effective 10/93):
Based on the presence of occurrence code A3, B3 or C3 move the related occurrence date to NCH_MDCR_BNFT_EXHST_DT. *NOTE: Prior to 10/93, the date associated with occurrence code 23 was moved to this field.
docs.title: NCH Beneficiary Medicare Benefits Exhausted Date

Short SAS Name:  BLDFRNSH  Long SAS Name:  NCH_BLOOD_PNTS_FRNSHD_QTY   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Outpatient RIF  Inpatient RIF   Number of whole pints of blood furnished to the beneficiary, as reported on the carrier claim (non-DMERC).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_VAL_CD
CLM_VAL_AMT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of value code equal to 37 move the related value amount to the NCH_BLOOD_PT_FRNSH_QTY.

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  SBMTCHRG  Long SAS Name:  NCH_CARR_CLM_SBMTD_CHRG_AMT   Contained in   Durable Medical Equipment RIF  Carrier RIF   Effective with Version H, the total submitted charges on the claim (the sum of line item submitted charges).  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated with data throughout history (back to service year 1991).
docs.title: NCH Carrier Claim Submitted Charge Amount*

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  BENE_PMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_CLM_BENE_PMT_AMT   Contained in   Durable Medical Equipment RIF  Carrier RIF   Effective with Version H, the total payments made to the beneficiary for this claim (sum of line payment amounts to the beneficiary.)  NOTE: Beginning with NCH weekly process date 10/3/97 this field was populated with data. Claims processed prior to 10/3/97 will contain zeroes in this field.
docs.title: NCH Claim Beneficiary Payment Amount*

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PROV_PMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_CLM_PRVDR_PMT_AMT   Contained in   Durable Medical Equipment RIF  Carrier RIF   Effective with Version H, the total payments made to the provider for this claim (sum of line item provider payment amounts.)   NOTE: Beginning with NCH weekly process date 10/3/97 this field was populated with data. Claims processed prior to 10/3/97 will contain zeroes in this field.
docs.title: NCH Claim Provider Payment Amount*

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  OUTLRPMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_DRG_OUTLIER_APRVD_PMT_AMT   Contained in   Inpatient RIF   On an institutional claim, the additional payment amount approved by the Peer Review Organization due to an outlier situation for a beneficiary's stay under the prospective payment system, which has been classified into a specific diagnosis related group.  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_VAL_CD
CLM_VAL_AMT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of value code equal to 17 move the related amount to NCH_DRG_OUTLIER_APRV_PMT_AMT.
docs.title: NCH DRG Outlier Approved Payment Amount

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  NCCHGAMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_IP_NCVRD_CHRG_AMT   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   Effective with Version H, the noncovered charges for all accommodations and services, reported on an inpatient claim (used for internal CWFMQA editing purposes).  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated with data throughout history (back to service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
REV_CNTR_CD
REV_CNTR_NCVR_CHRG_AMT DERVIATION RULES:
Based on the presence of revenue center code equal to 0001 move the related noncovered charge amount to NCH_IP_NCOV_CHRG_AMT.
docs.title: NCH Inpatient Noncovered Charge Amount

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  TDEDAMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_IP_TOT_DDCTN_AMT   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   Effective with Version H, the total Part A deductions reported on the Inpatient claim (used for internal CWFMQA editing purposes).  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated with data throughout history (back to 1991), but the derivation rule applied was in- complete for claims processed prior to 10/93. Disregard any data present in this field on claims with NCH weekly process date earlier than 10/93.  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_VAL_CD
CLM_VAL_AMT DERIVATION RULES (Effective 10/93):
Accumulate the value amounts associated with value codes equal to 06, 08 thru 11 and A1, B1 or C1 and move to IP_TOT_DDCTN_AMT.
NOTE: Value codes 08-11 did not exist in the NCH prior to 2/93; values codes A1, B1, C1 did not exist prior to 10/93.
docs.title: NCH Inpatient Total Deduction Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  RIC_CD  Long SAS Name:  NCH_NEAR_LINE_REC_IDENT_CD   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Outpatient RIF  Inpatient RIF  Hospice RIF  Home Health Agency RIF  Durable Medical Equipment RIF  Carrier RIF   A code defining the type of claim record being processed.
docs.title: NCH Near Line Record Identification Code

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  PTNTSTUS  Long SAS Name:  NCH_PTNT_STATUS_IND_CD   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF  Hospice RIF   Effective with Version H, the code on an inpatient/SNF and Hospice claim, indicating whether the beneficiary was discharged, died or still a patient (used for internal CWFMQA editing purposes.)  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated throughout history (back to service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
NCH PTNT_DSCHRG_STUS_CD
DERIVATION RULES:
SET NCH_PTNT_STUS_IND_CD TO 'A' WHERE THE
PTNT_DSCHRG_STUS_CD NOT EQUAL TO '20'- '30'
OR '40' - '42'.
SET NCH_PTNT_STUS_IND_CD TO 'B' WHERE THE
PTNT_DSCHRG_STUS_CD EQUAL TO '20'- '29'
OR '40' - '42'.
SET NCH_PTNT_STUS_IND_CD TO 'C' WHERE THE
PTNT_DSCHRG_STUS_CD EQUAL TO '30'
docs.title: NCH Patient Status Indicator Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRPAYAMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_PRMRY_PYR_CLM_PD_AMT
docs.title: NCH Primary Payer Claim Paid Amount*

docs.title: NCH Primary Payer Code

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PCCHGAMT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_PROFNL_CMPNT_CHRG_AMT   Contained in   Outpatient RIF  Inpatient RIF   This field is the amount of physician and other professional charges covered under Medicare Part B.  This variable is not populated for Home Health or Hospice claims. This field is used for CMS editing purposes and other internal processes (e.g. if computing interim payments, then these charges are deducted). The source of information for this field for institutional claims is the CLM_VAL_AMT (when the code = 04 or 05, it indicates a professional component charge amount). For Outpatient claims, this information is from the revenue center codes (when the code=096 , 097  or 098*, then the REV_CNTR_TOT_CHRG_AMT indicates a professional component charge amount).
docs.title: NCH Professional Component Charge Amount

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  PRSTATE  Long SAS Name:  PRVDR_STATE_CD
docs.title: NCH Provider State Code

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  QLFYFROM   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF   Effective with Version H, the beginning date of  the beneficiary's qualifying stay (used for internal  CWFMQA editing purposes).  For inpatient claims, the  date relates to the PPS portion of the inlier for  which there is no utilization to benefits. For  SNF claims, the date relates to a qualifying stay  from a hospital that is at least two days in a row  if the source of admission is an 'A', or at least  three days in a row if the source of admission  is other than 'A'.  NOTE:  During the Version H conversion this field  was populated with data throughout history (back to  service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_CD
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_FROM_DT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of occurrence code 70 move the related occurrence from date to NCH_QLFY_STAY_FROM_DT.
docs.title: NCH Qualified Stay From Date

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  QLFYTHRU   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF   Effective with Version H, the ending date of  the beneficiary's qualifying stay (used for internal  CWFMQA editing purposes.)   For inpatient claims, the  date relates to the PPS portion of the inlier for  which there is no utilization to benefits. For  SNF claims, the date relates to a qualifying stay  from a hospital that is at least two days in a row  if the source of admission is an 'A', or at least  three days in a row if the source of admission  is other than 'A'.  NOTE:  During the Version H, conversion this field  was populated with data throughout history (back to  service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_CD
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_THRU_DT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of occurrence code 70 move the related occurrence thru date to NCH_QLFY_STAY_THRU_DT.
docs.title: NCH Qualify Stay Through Date

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  NCOVFROM  Long SAS Name:  NCH_VRFD_NCVRD_STAY_FROM_DT   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   Effective with Version H, the beginning date of the beneficiary's noncovered stay (used for internal CWFMQA editing purposes.)  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated with data throughout history (back to service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_CD
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_FROM_DT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of occurrence code 74, 76, 77 or 79 move the related occurrence from date to NCH_VRFY_NCOV_STAY_FROM_DT.
docs.title: NCH Verified Noncovered Stay From Date

docs.text:
Short SAS Name:  NCOVTHRU  Long SAS Name:  NCH_VRFD_NCVRD_STAY_THRU_DT   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Inpatient RIF   Effective with Version H, the ending date of the beneficiary's noncovered stay (used for internal CWFMQA editing purposes.)  NOTE: During the Version H conversion this field was populated with data throughout history (back to service year 1991).  Derivation DERIVED FROM:
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_CD
CLM_OCRNC_SPAN_THRU_DT DERIVATION RULES:
Based on the presence of occurrence code 74, 76, 77 or 79 move the related occurrence thru date to NCH_VRFY_NCOV_STAY_THRU_DT.
docs.title: NCH Verified Noncovered Stay Through Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  WKLY_DT  Long SAS Name:  NCH_WKLY_PROC_DT   Contained in   Skilled Nursing Facility RIF  Outpatient RIF  Inpatient RIF  Hospice RIF  Home Health Agency RIF  Durable Medical Equipment RIF  Carrier RIF   The date the weekly NCH database load process cycle begins, during which the claim records are loaded into the Nearline file. This date will always be a Friday, although the claims will actually be appended to the database subsequent to the date.
docs.title: NCH Weekly Claim Processing Date

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  NDI_DOD  Long SAS Name:  NDI_DOD   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This field indicates that an enrollee's date of death has been verified as the exact date of becoming deceased, according to a death certificate.
docs.title: NDI Date of Death

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DEATH_CERT_NUM   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This field represents the death certificate number of the beneficiary.
docs.title: NDI Death Certificate Number

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  ENTITY_COND_1 (through ENTITY_COND_8)   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This field identifies the first eight underlying causes of death codes as listed by the certifier of death (formatted but not audited).
docs.title: NDI Entity Axis Cause of Death - Condition

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  RECORD_COND_1 (through RECORD_COND_8)   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This field identifies the first eight underlying causes of death codes as edited and audited by National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).
docs.title: NDI Record Axis Cause of Death - Condition

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  NDI_STATE_DEATH_CD   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This field identifies the state where the beneficiary death occurred.
docs.title: NDI State of Death

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OBESITY_MEDICARE   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable indicates whether a beneficiary met the condition criteria for obesity as of the end of the calendar year.  NOTE: The condition variable requires beneficiaries to satisfy both claims criteria (a minimum number/type of Medicare claims that have the proper diagnosis codes and occurred within a specified time period) and coverage criteria (Medicare FFS Part A and Part B coverage during the entire specified time period).  NOTE1: For obesity, beneficiaries must have at least one Medicare inpatient claim or two other non-drug claims of any service type with a related code in any position during the 2-year reference period. You can find more detailed information on the criteria on the CCW website: https://www.ccwdata.org/web/guest/condition-categories
docs.title: Obesity End-of-Year Indicator - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  OBESITY_MEDICARE_EVER   Contained in   Master Beneficiary Summary File   This variable shows the date when the beneficiary first met the criteria for the obesity indicator. The variable will be blank for beneficiaries that have never had the condition.  NOTE: The earliest possible date for anyone in the CCW is January 1, 1999. If the beneficiary became eligible for Medicare after that, the earliest possible date will be some time after his/her coverage start date (i.e., the COVSTART variable in the Beneficiary File).
docs.title: Obesity First Ever Occurrence Date - Medicare Only Claims

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  DSH_OP  Long SAS Name:  DSH_OP_CLM_VAL_AMT   Contained in   Inpatient RIF   Derived value created on extract from Claim value amount where value code =  18 .
docs.title: Operating Disproportionate Share Amount*

docs.text: Short SAS Name:  IME_OP  Long SAS Name:  IME_OP_CLM_VAL_AMT   Contained in   Inpatient RIF   Derived value created on extract from Claim value amount where value code =  19 .
docs.title: Operating Indirect Medical Education (IME) Amount*
